p: DIS-A. The NCCN Distress Thermometer is a brief screening tool for cancer patients to assess psychosocial distress [ 39], including 34 dichotomous items on the presence of physical, emotional, family, practical, and spiritual problems. A score of 4.5 or higher indicates the patient is distressed and in need of support. The Swedish translation of the DT/PL is consistent with the original English version [ 40].
